riemann_hypothesis.name: Riemann Hypothesis
riemann_hypothesis.statement: All non-trivial zeros of the Riemann zeta function lie on the critical line Re(s) = 1/2

sacred_connections.11: Prime resonance - RH is about prime distribution
sacred_connections.333: Trinity cubed - 3 aspects (zeta, zeros, primes) interconnected

riemann_hypothesis.ti_sigma_6_angle: Zeta zeros as i-cells in GM's field with 0.5 resonance frequency
known_facts: First 10 trillion zeros verified on critical line
Equivalent to Prime Number Theorem error bound
ti_approach: Model zeros as i-cells with CCC-determined positions
Use GILE resonance to explain 1/2 critical value
Prove zeros CANNOT exist off critical line (via GM structure)
Connect to Grand Myrion's 35% choice of prime distribution

p_vs_np.name: P vs NP Problem
p_vs_np.statement: Does P = NP? (Can every problem whose solution can be verified quickly also be solved quickly?)
p_vs_np.ti_sigma_6_angle: Verification vs creation as CCC's 1/3 vs 2/3 structure
known_facts: Most computer scientists believe P ≠ NP
Practical importance: cryptography depends on P≠NP
ti_approach: P = verification (1/3 sovereignty - checking existing)
NP = creation (2/3 structure - generating new)
P ≠ NP because verification ≠ creation (fundamental asymmetry)
Prove via CCC free will structure (creating harder than verifying)

navier_stokes.name: Navier-Stokes Existence and Smoothness
navier_stokes.statement: Do smooth solutions to Navier-Stokes equations exist for all time in 3D?

known_facts: 3D case: either smooth solutions or blow-up in finite time

Smoothness = CCC coherence (0.91 GILE prevents chaos)
Prove smoothness via GM's structural guarantee
Turbulence = approaching but never exceeding LCC threshold (0.85)

yang_mills.name: Yang-Mills and Mass Gap

birch_swinnerton_dyer.name: Birch and Swinnerton-Dyer Conjecture
birch_swinnerton_dyer.statement: Rank of elliptic curve equals order of zero of L-function at s=1
